bestBHT.bht: Their intentional ignorance and refusal to take a stand absolved Jesus from providing a categorical reply to their question. He was determined not to let them off the hook at this point. Their dilemma left them in the greatest difficulty and they were aware that disclosing what they knew about John the Baptist would expose themselves. Therefore, Jesus chose not to reveal by what authority he performed miracles and carried out his actions.

Archibald T. Robertson: Their self-imposed ignorance, refusal to take a stand about the Baptist...absolved Jesus from a categorical reply.
But he has no notion of letting them off at this point.
John Gill: Being reduced by this dilemma to the greatest streight and difficulty."
They could, if they would, but they did not care to tell; they knew if they did, they should expose themselves one way or other.
Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.

bhtAttempts.bht: It is clear that the individuals who posed the question to Jesus in this verse were avoiding taking a stand in regard to the authority of John the Baptist. Their deliberate ignorance and refusal to provide an answer warranted Jesus' decision to not provide a straightforward reply. He was not willing to let them off the hook that easily. Their dilemma left them in a difficult predicament, as they were aware that disclosing what they knew about John the Baptist would potentially expose their own lack of faith or opposition to Jesus. In withholding an answer, Jesus effectively conveyed that he would not reveal by what authority he performed miracles and carried out his ministry.

The questioners in this passage were excused from a direct response due to their intentional ignorance and unwillingness to take a stance on John the Baptist. Jesus was determined not to let them off the hook that easily. Their dilemma left them in a difficult position, as they knew that revealing what they knew about John the Baptist would expose their lack of faith or opposition to Jesus. Jesus responded by withholding an answer, conveying that he would not disclose the authority behind his miraculous works and ministry.

Their deliberate ignorance and refusal to take a stand absolved Jesus from giving a straightforward reply to their question. He was not willing to let them off the hook so easily. Their dilemma left them in a difficult position, knowing that disclosing what they knew about John the Baptist would potentially expose their own lack of faith or opposition to Jesus. Thus, Jesus chose not to reveal by what authority he performed miracles and carried out his ministry.

Their intentional ignorance and refusal to take a stand absolved Jesus from providing a categorical reply to their question. He was determined not to let them off the hook at this point. Their dilemma left them in the greatest difficulty and they were aware that disclosing what they knew about John the Baptist would expose themselves. Therefore, Jesus chose not to reveal by what authority he performed miracles and carried out his actions.

The questioners’ self-imposed ignorance and refusal to take a stand regarding John the Baptist relieved Jesus from the obligation to give a direct response. However, he had no intention of allowing them to escape the matter at hand. Their dilemma left them in a state of great difficulty, knowing that revealing their knowledge about John the Baptist would expose their own true beliefs or opposition to Jesus. Subsequently, Jesus withheld an answer, declining to disclose the authority behind his miraculous deeds and ministry.
